WorkItem.Description:
I am not able to use AutoMapper 1.1 RTW in Visual Studio 2010, version 1.0 however works fine.
Â 
Anyone else experiencing this?

Comments.Message:
Hi,
Works for me in an ASP.Net MVC 2 website in VS 2010.
What exactly is the error you get?

Thanks

Hi,

the error I get is:

"The type or namespace name 'AutoMapper' could not be found (are you missing a using directive or an assembly reference?)"

The answer to that question is no, I am referencing the AutoMapper.dll and added a using statement.

I am attaching a VS2010 project showing the problem.
Also experience this issue.  Appears to work in an MVC project but I see the issue in a Class Library or a Console App project.  Any guidance would be appreciated.
Fixed this. AutoMapper appears to require the full .NET target framework 4.0, not the Client Profile subset.  Changed this in the project settings and it's working correctly.

I've verified your solution adrianwright, and you are correct. It seems that AutoMapper require the full .NET4 framework, however I think the developers have made a mistake here. Forcing me to use the full framework, when the rest of my application can cope with the Client Profile, just doesn't seem correct.

APS.Net MCV has the target framework set to (full) .Net Framework 4.0. Try a Console app or class lib. By default both project template use the Client Profile. Work around: switch the target framework in your project property page to the Full .net framework 4.0.
